name: The powerfree part of the n-th cubefree number.
comment: Also, the squarefree part of the n-th cubefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^If[e == 1, 1, 0]; s[n_] := Module[{fct = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[fct[[;; , 2]], # < 3 &], Times @@ f @@@ fct, Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 3, print1(prod(i = 1, #f~, f[i, 1]^if(f[i, 2] == 1, 1, 0)), ", ")));}
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 07 2025

name: The squarefree kernel of the n-th cubefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: s[n_] := Module[{f = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[f[[;; , 2]], # < 3 &], Times @@ f[[;; , 1]], Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 3, print1(vecprod(f[, 1]), ", ")));}
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 07 2025

name: The largest square dividing the n-th cubefree number.
comment: Also, the powerful part of the n-th cubefree number.
All the terms are squares of squarefree numbers (A062503).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^If[e == 1, 0, 2]; s[n_] := Module[{fct = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[fct[[;; , 2]], # < 3 &], Times @@ f @@@ fct, Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 3, print1(prod(i = 1, #f~, f[i, 1]^if(f[i, 2] == 1, 0, 2)), ", ")));}
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 07 2025

name: The square root of the largest square dividing the n-th cubefree number.
comment: The product of the non-unitary prime divisors of the n-th cubefree number.
Also, the square root of the powerful part of the n-th cubefree number.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^If[e == 1, 0, 1]; s[n_] := Module[{fct = FactorInteger[n]}, If[AllTrue[fct[[;; , 2]], # < 3 &], Times @@ f @@@ fct, Nothing]]; Array[s, 100]
program: (PARI) list(lim) = {my(f); print1(1, ", "); for(k = 2, lim, f = factor(k); if(vecmax(f[, 2]) < 3, print1(prod(i = 1, #f~, f[i, 1]^if(f[i, 2] == 1, 0, 1)), ", ")));}
author: _Amiram Eldar_, Apr 07 2025
